text:
Add a <jsp> tag to the WAR task. This would put files in "WEB-INF/jsp". This
seems to be the de facto standard for placing protected JSPs in a war.

By protected, I mean any JSP that should not be directly accessible from outside
of the web application.

Patch will be attached.
creator: brad@crochet.net
jakarta@ehatchersolutions.com
text:
Just out of curiosity - where do you get that WEB-INF/jsp is the "de facto" 
standard?  Could you cite some references for us?  I personally don't use this 
standard, but place most of my JSP's under WEB-INF in other directory 
structures.

I guess the only place that I can find (*sheepish grin*) is Websphere Portal
server. This is really just a convenience feature. I think a more generic and
useful feature is outlined in bug 8986, that I also entered. It would somewhat
cover this one. I was originally going to place them both in 1 bug, but decided
against it for this very reason.
creator: brad@crochet.net

text:
I like the 'prefix' feature, and think we can just use that rather than adding 
a <jsp> element - just use <webinf prefix="jsp"> instead.  I'm going to close 
and mark as a duplicate of 8986, if thats ok with you.
